byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin, analysts say, is advancing goals in the Syrian conflict while President Obama is on the way out and his replacement is undetermined.

headline.print_headline: Election in U.S. Offers Kremlin Opening on Syria
headline.main: U.S. Election Cycle Offers Kremlin a Window of Opportunity in Syria

snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin, analysts say, is advancing goals in the Syrian conflict while President Obama is on the way out and his replacement is undetermined....
abstract: Analysts believe Russia is moving aggressively to help consolidate Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad's power in final days of Pres Obama's term and to constrain ability of next American president to intervene there; say Russian Pres Vladimir Putin is operating on assumption that Obama is unlikely to take bold action in Syrian civil war before election; Russian and Syrian military operations following end of cease-fire in September have been notably aggressive, lending credence to argument.
